member.name: T:Synthesys.SDK.Attributes.ConfigurableAttribute
member.summary: The ConfigurableAttribute specifies that the decorated property is configurable when the Extension is queued. A Dictionary{string,string} is used to configure each Extensions, where the key is the string name of the Configurable property, and the value is the string representation of the property's value. When the framework invokes this Extension, it will cast the string value to the given Type.

member.name: M:Synthesys.SDK.Attributes.ConfigurableAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Specify that the decorated property is configurable when the Extension is queued
Items marked with this Attribute can be configured when the Extension is executed.
member.param: Name of Configurable property (auto-generated from caller)

member.name: P:Synthesys.SDK.Attributes.ConfigurableAttribute.Name
member.summary: Name of the Configurable property

member.name: T:Synthesys.SDK.Attributes.ExtensionAttribute
member.summary: The ExtensionAttribute specifies the unique name used to address the Extension within the system and metadata about the Extension and author

member.name: M:Synthesys.SDK.Attributes.ExtensionAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Specify that this class implements an Extension
member.param: System-unique string to identify this Extension in logs and when being manually queued

member.name: P:Synthesys.SDK.Attributes.ExtensionAttribute.ExtensionIdentifier
member.summary: System-unique string to identify this Extension in logs and when being manually queued. Once this is set, changing it will break data objects dependent on this Extension.

member.summary: Display-friendly name of the Extension

member.summary: How and what the Extension accomplishes in more detail

member.name: T:Synthesys.SDK.Attributes.TriggeredByAttribute
member.summary: The TriggeredByAttribute specifies that the Extension is added to the end of the Task Queue when a certain event occurs. This Attribute can be used multiple times on the same Extension.

member.name: T:Synthesys.SDK.Extensions.ActionExtension
member.summary: An ActionExtension is generated from known information about a system. ActionExtensions are imported into the Artifact Tree in the same way as any discovered data. The intent is for the framework to use the information generated by ActionExtensions to create ReactionExtensions.

member.name: M:Synthesys.SDK.Extensions.ActionExtension.Act
member.summary: This method is called when the ActionExtension is popped from the Task Queue and executed

member.name: T:Synthesys.SDK.Extensions.Extension
member.summary: An Extension is some function, which can either be an Action or a Reaction, which executes with the intent of populating the Artifact Tree with additional data.

member.name: M:Synthesys.SDK.Extensions.Extension.Initialize
member.summary: Initialize Extension; called on instantiation

member.name: M:Synthesys.SDK.Extensions.Extension.ValidateEnvironmentReadiness
member.summary: Called when the Extension is loaded, to check if the runtime environment supports what the Extension requires to execute. Any application validation/dependency checks should happen here, but it is not required.

member.name: M:Synthesys.SDK.Extensions.Extension.SetLoggerName(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new Logger with a given name for this Extension

member.name: P:Synthesys.SDK.Extensions.Extension.Metadata
member.summary: Retrieve the Extension's metadata information

member.name: P:Synthesys.SDK.Extensions.Extension.ConfigurableProperties
member.summary: Retrieve a list of all properties in the Extension marked "Configurable"

member.name: P:Synthesys.SDK.Extensions.Extension.ConfigurablePropertyValues
member.summary: Retrieve a dictionary of all (string) properties and their values

member.name: T:Synthesys.SDK.Extensions.ReactionExtension
member.summary:
A ReactionExtension is added to the end of the Task Queue when some given event occurs during the scan process. The concept behind ReactionExtensions is to enrich the Artifact Tree and, in doing so, trigger other ReactionExtensions. ReactionExtensions can be triggered by:
ActionExtension completes or fails
Artifact Tree element has a child added to it
Artifact Tree element changes
Artifact Tree element is created
Task is started by the Task Queue
Task is completed
Task is added to the Task Queue
Task Queue is completely drained

member.name: M:Synthesys.SDK.Extensions.ReactionExtension.React(Synthesys.SDK.Triggers.TriggerDescriptor)
member.summary: This method is called when the ReactionExtension is popped from the Task Queue and executed
member.param: Trigger causing the ReactionExtension to fire

member.name: P:Synthesys.SDK.Extensions.ReactionExtension.Triggers
member.summary: Retrieve a list of Triggers which cause this Extension to react
